title: Ticket #2462: allow client tools to implement a local session cache
description:
client tools could avoid a relatively expensive security negotiation and authentication process if they were allowed to keep their own session cache. for example, condor_advertise could use this to authenticate just once every 24 hours instead of upon every invocation.

quick thoughts on milestones:

  1. keep the security (i.e. filesystem permissions) in mind at all times, use safe_open
  2. write a Serialize and Unserialize method for an individual security session
  3. implement an environment variable that forces outgoing commands to use a particular session serialized in a file
  4. implement serialization methods for the entire session cache
  5. allow a local credential wallet to be used and managed by the client side connection (condor daemons acting as clients may benefit from this as well, although they already have their in-memory session cache)
